upoints
Package upoints

Package upoints

upoints - Modules for working with points on Earth.

upoints is a collection of GPL v3 licensed modules for working with points on Earth, or other near spherical objects. It allows you to calculate the distance and bearings between points, mangle xearth/xplanet data files, work with online UK trigpoint databases, NOAA's weather station database and other such location databases.

The upoints.point module is the simplest interface available, and is mainly useful as a naïve object for simple calculation and subclassing for specific usage. An example of how to use it follows:

>>> Home = point.Point(52.015, -0.221)
>>> Telford = point.Point(52.6333, -2.5000)
>>> int(Home.distance(Telford))
169
>>> int(Home.bearing(Telford))
294
>>> int(Home.final_bearing(Telford))
293
>>> import datetime
>>> Home.sun_events(datetime.date(2007, 6, 28))
(datetime.time(3, 42), datetime.time(20, 25))
>>> Home.sunrise(datetime.date(2007, 6, 28))
datetime.time(3, 42)
>>> Home.sunset(datetime.date(2007, 6, 28))
datetime.time(20, 25)

Version: 0.11.0

Author: James Rowe

Copyright: Copyright (C) 2007-2008 James Rowe

Status: WIP

Submodules [hide private]
  • upoints.baken: baken - Imports baken data files
  • upoints.cellid: cellid - Imports OpenCellID data files
  • upoints.cities: cities - Imports GNU miscfiles cities data files
  • upoints.geonames: geonames - Imports geonames.org data files
  • upoints.gpx: gpx - Imports GPS eXchange format data files
  • upoints.kml: kml - Imports KML data files
  • upoints.nmea: nmea - Imports GPS NMEA-formatted data files
  • upoints.osm: osm - Imports OpenStreetMap data files
  • upoints.point: point - Class for working with locations on Earth
  • upoints.trigpoints: trigpoints - Imports trigpoint marker files
  • upoints.tzdata: tzdata - Imports timezone data files from UNIX zoneinfo
  • upoints.utils: utils - Support code for upoints
  • upoints.weather_stations: weather_stations - Imports weather station data files
  • upoints.xearth: xearth - Imports xearth-style marker files
